channel.title: Quotes on jrobb.org
channel.description: Recent content in Quotes on jrobb.org

item.title: Be the master of your domain
item.description: Be the master of your domain. Norm Hilgendorf This was in response to questions about professional advice in uncertain economic times, when layoffs were happening all around us.

item.title: Hope is not a method
item.description: Hope is not a method Gordon R. Sullivan and Michael V. Harper From the book “Hope Is Not a Method: What Business Leaders Can Learn from America’s Army”

item.title: Make everything better
item.description: Make everything better. Me I always say this is the mantra of my department/team, as well as in life!

item.title: Plan for the worst, hope for the best
item.description: Plan for the worst, hope for the best. Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: The 10 Dolph Commandments
item.description: Never Trust a Soul: Dolph emphasizes not trusting anyone, highlighting the importance of self-reliance in the streets. Keep Your Circle Small: He advises to only keep a tight-knit group around you, as too many people can lead to betrayal or leaks of information. Stay True to Yourself: Dolph talks about maintaining your authenticity despite fame or success, staying true to your roots and personal values. Money Over Everything: The focus here is on prioritizing financial stability and growth above all else, suggesting that money can solve many problems.

item.title: No Free Lunch
item.description: There is no free lunch. Sehat Sutardja

item.title: Proverbs 27:14
item.description: He who blesses his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, It will be counted a curse to him. Proverbs 27:14
